title: What is the mass of 3 moles of oxygen? - Quora

response.answer_text: One mole of oxygen atoms has a mass of 16g. So three moles of oxygen atoms would have a mass of 48g. However, you would never get moles of oxygen “atoms”, as oxygen always pairs up into molecules of O2. And one mole of oxygen molecules has a mass of 32g, so three moles would have a mass of 96g. Oxygen atoms occur naturally, but only temporarily, as they are highly reactive. So you wouldn’t naturally get a mole of oxygen atoms.

Formula for finding the number of moles is: n = m/M.M Where, n= no. of moles of oxygen m = mass of oxygen M.M = molar mass of oxygen For finding the mass of oxygen, cross multiply the above equation, we get: m = n × M.M n = 3 moles, & molar mass = 32g/mol So m = 3 × 32 m = 96g
